title: Facebook, Google, Other Tech Giants To Face Digital Tax Starting 2022, Canada Says
text: Technology giants like Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) will have to pay a digital tax in Canada beginning 2022, Reuters reported Monday. What Happened: The tax on digital services will stay in place until nations can agree on a unified approach on taxation on the tech giants, the country's finance department said, as per Reuters.

title: Facebook Agrees To Acquire $1B Startup Kustomer To Improve Services For Businesses
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) said Monday it has agreed to purchase Kustomer, an omnichannel customer relationship management company that develops solutions such as interactive chatbots. What Happened: The Mark Zuckerberg-led social media giant said in a statement that its goal in acquiring the New York-based Kustomer was to give businesses access to tools that “deliver excellent service and support.

title: Biden urged to reject Big Tech's influence by 32 advocacy groups
text: Thirty-two groups including ones focused on antitrust, consumer advocacy and progressive issues sent a letter to President-elect Joe Biden on Monday urging him to reject the influence of Big Tech companies on his administration.

The deal could close by the end of the day on Monday (Nov. 30) and would value the New York-headquartered startup at more than $1 billion, the […]

title: The FTC and state attorneys general are reportedly aiming up to 4 new antitrust lawsuits at Facebook and Google as talk of regulation continues to heat up (FB, GOOG)
text: Federal and state officials are gearing up to slap Facebook and Google with up to four new antitrust lawsuits by the end of January 2021, according to a Monday report from The Wall Street Journal. The lawsuits are intended to determine if the internet giants improperly used their power in the online marketplace, per the report, and will be launched by the Federal Trade Commission, state attorneys general, and other authorities.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook nears deal to buy startup valued at $1 billion
text: Facebook Inc. is nearing a deal to buy Kustomer, a startup that specializes in customer-service platforms and chatbots, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook and Google set to face new antitrust suits in U.S.
text: Big Tech's legal woes are expected to worsen in the coming weeks as federal and state antitrust authorities prepare to file new lawsuits against Facebook Inc. and Alphabet Inc.'s Google, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Peter Morici: Antitrust crackdown on Big Tech could impair U.S. competitiveness
text: Some practices need reining in, but breaking up American Big Tech companies would give Chinese tech companies a clear road to dominance.

title: Facebook Joins Amazon, Disney In India's Hot Cricket Streaming Market
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) has partnered with Sony Corporation's  (NYSE: SNE) Indian unit to bring video-on-demand content of India's ongoing cricket tour of Australia. What Happened: The Mark Zuckerberg-led company's digital content partnership with Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) spans multiple cricket formats including four test matches, according to India's Moneycontrol portal.
